text: Maurice Deligne (7 October 1861 - 11 July 1939) was a French politician. He served as a member of the Chamber of Deputies from 1928 to 1936, representing Nord. He was also the Minister of Public Works from 27 January 1931 to 16 February 1932. ==References== Category:1861 births Category:1939 deaths Category:People from Nord (French department) Category:Politicians from Hauts- de-France Category:Independent Radical politicians Category:French Ministers of Public Works Category:Members of the 14th Chamber of Deputies of the French Third Republic Category:Members of the 15th Chamber of Deputies of the French Third Republic
title: Maurice Deligne
